keyFactors.title: Boston's Catastrophic Rebounding
keyFactors.description: Celtics ranked DEAD LAST in defensive rebounding, allowing opponents astronomical 41.6% OREB rate (worst in NBA by 4%). Surrendering 24.7 second-chance PPG.

keyFactors.title: Key Celtics Injuries
keyFactors.description: Jayson Tatum (Achilles) out - removed their best defensive rebounder (93rd+ percentile among forwards). Also missing Xavier Tillman, Kristaps Porzingis, Al Horford, Luke Kornet.

keyFactors.title: No Interior Size
keyFactors.description: Boston completely depleted of big men. Left them without interior protection, creating abundant opportunities for Banchero to dominate glass.

keyFactors.title: Plus Odds Value
keyFactors.description: At +110, getting excellent odds despite Banchero's 9.5 RPG average being 1.0 above the 8.5 line. Market underpriced the matchup.

riskFactors: Orlando's balanced scoring could limit Banchero's rebounds if teammates crash boards
Competitive game could go either way - minutes uncertainty
NBA Cup pressure in Group B opener

quarterBreakdown.description: Orlando jumped to 38-25 lead in fast-paced start. Banchero established presence on glass early against undersized Celtics.
Boston rallied to tie 62-62 in third and took brief 96-95 lead midway through Q4. Competitive game kept Banchero engaged for heavy minutes.
Orlando closed on 17-4 run. Banchero played 36 minutes (second-most behind Franz Wagner's 37) with zero fouls, staying on court for every critical possession.

gameResults.whenCleared: Mid-Q3, finished with comfortable 9 rebounds (0.5 cushion above line)
gameResults.gamePace: Competitive throughout until final 5 minutes. Both teams at 44 total rebounds, but Banchero secured his share in frontcourt alongside Wendell Carter Jr. (5 reb) and Goga Bitadze (7 off bench).

whatWentRight.title: Perfect Matchup Exploitation
whatWentRight.description: Boston's last-ranked defensive rebounding (41.6% OREB allowed) created ideal environment. Missing Tatum, Porzingis, Horford, Kornet left massive void.

whatWentRight.title: Defensive Rebounding Focus
whatWentRight.description: 8 of 9 rebounds were defensive, fitting Banchero's typical pattern (not crash-the-glass offensive player). Dominated defensive glass as designed.

whatWentRight.title: Line Below Season Average
whatWentRight.description: 8.5 line was exactly 1.0 rebounds below his 9.5 season average. At +110 odds, implied probability only 47.6% despite 60%+ hit rate over 8.5.

whatWentRight.title: Zero Fouls, Heavy Minutes
whatWentRight.description: No foul trouble, played 36 minutes at home in important NBA Cup game. Fresh legs with full rest.

statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: On pace with 9.3 RPG last 3 games
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Consistent performance - maintained season pace against favorable matchup

closingLineValue.verdict: Excellent value regardless of CLV. +110 odds on a player averaging 9.5 RPG against NBA's worst defensive rebounding team was mispriced by market.

keyTakeaways: When rebounding line is below season average (8.5 vs 9.5) AND facing worst defensive rebounding team = exceptional value
Key injuries matter - Tatum's absence removed Boston's best rebounder
Home games in important contexts (NBA Cup opener) ensure heavy minutes
+110 odds represented 47.6% implied probability but actual hit rate was 60%+
Cleared with 0.5 cushion - not huge margin but comfortable cash
verdict: Textbook matchup-based betting. Boston's catastrophic defensive rebounding (worst in NBA) combined with key injuries and line below average created perfect storm.
